result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. If CPS is involved, Defendant must abide by all orders. If CPS is not involved, child can not reside with Defendant unless ordered by Family Court.

03:03 PM Defendant Violet La Trice McKnight in court, by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Francis P Raff by video means.  Cheniqua White and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set, comply with any and all CPS orders, if CPS is not involved, child may not reside with defendant until an order from family court is secured, absolute sobriety, not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
